intro: Rudgea retifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded forest understories. Rudgea retifolia is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
